00047 #if wxUSE_ACCESSIBILITY
00048 
00049 class HtmlWindowAx: public wxWindowAccessible
00050 {
00051 public:
00052    HtmlWindowAx(wxWindow * window);
00053 
00054    virtual ~ HtmlWindowAx();
00055 
00056    // Retrieves the address of an IDispatch interface for the specified child.
00057    // All objects must support this property.
00058    virtual wxAccStatus GetChild( int childId, wxAccessible** child );
00059 
00060    // Gets the number of children.
00061    virtual wxAccStatus GetChildCount(int* childCount);
00062 
00063    // Gets the default action for this object (0) or > 0 (the action for a child).
00064    // Return wxACC_OK even if there is no action. actionName is the action, or the empty
00065    // string if there is no action.
00066    // The retrieved string describes the action that is performed on an object,
00067    // not what the object does as a result. For example, a toolbar button that prints
00068    // a document has a default action of "Press" rather than "Prints the current document."
00069    virtual wxAccStatus GetDefaultAction( int childId, wxString *actionName );
00070 
00071    // Returns the description for this object or a child.
00072    virtual wxAccStatus GetDescription( int childId, wxString *description );
00073 
00074    // Gets the window with the keyboard focus.
00075    // If childId is 0 and child is NULL, no object in
00076    // this subhierarchy has the focus.
00077    // If this object has the focus, child should be 'this'.
00078    virtual wxAccStatus GetFocus( int *childId, wxAccessible **child );
00079 
00080    // Returns help text for this object or a child, similar to tooltip text.
00081    virtual wxAccStatus GetHelpText( int childId, wxString *helpText );
00082 
00083    // Returns the keyboard shortcut for this object or child.
00084    // Return e.g. ALT+K
00085    virtual wxAccStatus GetKeyboardShortcut( int childId, wxString *shortcut );
00086 
00087    // Returns the rectangle for this object (id = 0) or a child element (id > 0).
00088    // rect is in screen coordinates.
00089    virtual wxAccStatus GetLocation( wxRect& rect, int elementId );
00090 
00091    // Gets the name of the specified object.
00092    virtual wxAccStatus GetName( int childId, wxString *name );
00093 
00094    // Returns a role constant.
00095    virtual wxAccStatus GetRole( int childId, wxAccRole *role );
00096 
00097    // Gets a variant representing the selected children
00098    // of this object.
00099    // Acceptable values:
00100    // - a null variant (IsNull() returns TRUE)
00101    // - a list variant (GetType() == wxT("list"))
00102    // - an integer representing the selected child element,
00103    //   or 0 if this object is selected (GetType() == wxT("long"))
00104    // - a "void*" pointer to a wxAccessible child object
00105    virtual wxAccStatus GetSelections( wxVariant *selections );
00106 
00107    // Returns a state constant.
00108    virtual wxAccStatus GetState(int childId, long* state);
00109 
00110    // Returns a localized string representing the value for the object
00111    // or child.
00112    virtual wxAccStatus GetValue(int childId, wxString* strValue);
00113 
00114 };
